intro: Scabiosa columbaria var. vestita, commonly known as the white scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender, branching stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. The flowers are often arranged in clusters and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
